    Prepare plot information for a single-input experiment (length in meter)

    prep_plot_m.Rd

    Prepare plot information for a single-input experiment case. All the length values need to be specified in meter.

    prep_plot_m(
  input_name,
  machine_width,
  section_num,
  harvester_width,
  plot_width = NA,
  headland_length = NA,
  side_length = NA,
  max_plot_width = measurements::conv_unit(120, "ft", "m"),
  min_plot_length = measurements::conv_unit(240, "ft", "m"),
  max_plot_length = measurements::conv_unit(300, "ft", "m")
)

    Arguments

    input_name

    (character) Input name

    machine_width

    (numeric) A numeric number in meter that indicates the width of the applicator or planter of the input

    section_num

    (numeric) A numeric number that indicates the number of sections of the applicator or planter of the input

    harvester_width

    (numeric) A numeric number in meter that indicates the width of the harvester

    plot_width

    (numeric) Default is c(NA, NA).

    headland_length

    (numeric) A numeric number in meter that indicates the length of the headland (how long the non-experimental space is in the direction machines drive). Default is NA.

    side_length

    (numeric) A numeric number in meter that indicates the length of the two sides of the field (how long the non-experimental space is in the direction perpendicular to the direction of machines). Default is NA.

    max_plot_width

    (numeric) Maximum width of the plots in meter. Default is 36.576 meter (120 feet).

    min_plot_length

    (numeric) Minimum length of the plots in meter. Default is 73.152 meter (240 feet).

    max_plot_length

    (numeric) Maximum length of the plots in meter. Default is 91.440 meter (300 feet)

    Value

    a tibble with plot information necessary to create experiment plots

    Examples

    input_name <- "seed"
machine_width <- 12
section_num <- 12
plot_width <- NA
harvester_width <- 24
prep_plot_m(input_name, machine_width, section_num, harvester_width)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 10
#>   input_name machine_w…¹ secti…² secti…³ harve…⁴ plot_…⁵ headl…⁶ side_…⁷ min_p…⁸
#>   <chr>            <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 seed                12      12       1      24      24      24    9.14    73.2
#> # … with 1 more variable: max_plot_length <dbl>, and abbreviated variable names
#> #   ¹​machine_width, ²​section_num, ³​section_width, ⁴​harvester_width,
#> #   ⁵​plot_width, ⁶​headland_length, ⁷​side_length, ⁸​min_plot_length
